result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerrell Lamont Clark

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark not in court, in custody.  Attorney Catelin Ringersma in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status of counsel. PD's appointment office unable to appoint for hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Jerrell Lamont Clark.  Attorney Catelin Ringersma appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defense's motion to withdraw heard. State takes no position. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (26 pages) commencing 08-16-22 by KRISTIN MENZIA.

Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark in court, appear by video with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video.  Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Detective Martin Keck.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Bail Bond Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JA, RA, JZ, VV, MF, TP, MP, MN, JN, ND, MW, EM and co actors SLM, JADS, BAB, DLJ.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $100,000.00 If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. No contact order monitoring only.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark in custody.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
